data.title: 1976 Hoosiers After IU
data.meta_description:
PLAYERS

TOM ABERNETHY: B.S. in Business, 1976. Drafted by the Los Angeles Lakers in the third round of NBA draft. Played with Lakers, Golden State and Indiana Pacers. Now owns and operates the Abernethy Co. in Indianapolis, dealing in industrial real estate. Also runs the Indianapolis Basketball Academy, a basketball training facility.QUINN BUCKNER: B.S. in Administration, 1976. Was the No. 1 draft pick of the Milwaukee Bucks in 1976. Played 10 years in the league with the Bucks and Boston Celtics. Was a member of Boston\\'s 1984 NBA championship team. Also named to the Indiana University Athletic Hall of Fame. Presently working as a basketball analyst for ESPN and Fox Sports.BOB BENDER: transferred to Duke after \\'76 season and played on Duke\\'s 1978 NCAA finalists. Now the head coach at the University of Washington.KENT BENSON: B.S. in Recreation, 1977. The Milwaukee Bucks made him the No. 1 pick in the 1977 NBA draft. Also played for Detroit, Utah and Cleveland. Selected to the Indiana Athletic Hall of Fame in 1999. Now heads All-American Estate Planning in Bloomington.JIM CREWS: B.S. in Business, 1976. Served as an assistant to Bob Knight for eight years before becoming the head coach of Evansville in 1985-86. Just completed his 16th year with the Aces.SCOTT EELLS: B.S. in Recreation, 1979. Presently employed by the Cook Group in Bloomington.MARK HAYMORE: transferred to the University of Massachusetts after the \\'76 season.SCOTT MAY: B.S. in Education, 1976. No. 1 draft pick of the Chicago Bulls in \\'76, the No. 2 pick overall. Played with Chicago, Milwaukee and Detroit before finishing up his career in Italy. The IU Hall of Famer now owns and manages apartments in the Bloomington area.DON NOORT: B.S. in Management, 1976. Presently in paper industry in Lexington, Ky.WAYNE RADFORD: B.S. in Business, 1978. The Indiana Pacers made him the 27th player taken in the \\'78 NBA draft. Played one year of professional ball. Now lives in Indianapolis and serves as the district manager for the Cook Surgical Division.JIM ROBERSON: dismissed from the team during the 1978-79 season.RICH VALAVICIUS: transferred to Auburn after the 1976-77 season.BOB WILKERSON: B.S. in Physical Education. Drafted in the first round by Seattle, he played with the Sonics, Denver, Chicago and Cleveland. Completed his degree at the University of Colorado. Now coaches boys\\' basketball at Indianapolis Northwest High.JIM WISMAN: B.S. in Business, 1978. Spent four years with Cummins Engine Co. in Columbus. Now is Executive Vice President for Leo Burnett Advertising in Chicago.

COACHES

HAROLD ANDREAS: Retired after the 1976-77 season. Deceased.BOB DONEWALD: went on to become the head coach at Illinois State and Western Michigan.BOB WELTLICH: After leaving Indiana in \\'76, he coached five years at Florida International and most recently at South Alabama, where he completed his fourth year.BOB KNIGHT: Coached Indiana for 24 more years and to 536 more victories, seven more Big Ten titles and two more NCAA championships. Dismissed by Indiana prior to the 2000-2001 season. Now head coach at Texas Tech.

TOM ABERNETHY: B.S. in Business, 1976. Drafted by the Los Angeles Lakers in the third round of NBA draft. Played with Lakers, Golden State and Indiana Pacers. Now owns and operates the Abernethy Co. in Indianapolis, dealing in industrial real estate. Played 10 years in the league with the Bucks and Boston Celtics. Was a member of Boston\'s 1984 NBA championship team. Also named to the Indiana University Athletic Hall of Fame. Presently working as a basketball analyst for ESPN and Fox Sports.BOB BENDER: transferred to Duke after \'76 season and played on Duke\'s 1978 NCAA finalists. HAROLD ANDREAS: Retired after the 1976-77 season. Dismissed by Indiana prior to the 2000-2001 season. Now head coach at Texas Tech.
